articles.title: Another Milestone! Webb Space Telescope Completes First Multi-Instrument Alignment - SciTechDaily

articles.author: Kaya Burgess
articles.title: T rex's tiny arms may have been a life-saver - The Times
articles.description: Tyrannosaurus rex had such tiny forearms because it kept them out of the way of snapping jaws during pack feeding frenzies, a palaeontologist has suggested.
articles.content:
Tyrannosaurus rex had such tiny forearms because it kept them out of the way of snapping jaws during pack feeding frenzies, a palaeontologist has suggested.

articles.title: The bizarre discovery that means life on Mars will be a real conversation killer - The Telegraph
articles.description: Red Planet has two speeds of sound, with high-pitched noises travelling faster than lower notes, making speech difficult to decipher
articles.content:
It is said that in space no one can hear you scream. But on Mars, rest assured, your screams will be heard more quickly.
